meanings.definition: To tell someone a secret or private matter.
meanings.sent1: She confides in her best friend about her crush.
meanings.sent2: He always confides in his sister when he needs advice.
meanings.sent3: The cat confides in the mouse about its plan to catch the bird.
meanings.sent4: The old tree confides in the wind, sharing its stories from centuries past.
meanings.sent5: The detective confides in his partner, revealing the key clue to solve the case.

meanings.definition: To trust someone with private information.
meanings.sent1: The child confides in his teacher, knowing she will keep his secret.
meanings.sent2: She confides in her therapist, feeling safe to share her thoughts.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel confides in the tree to hide its acorn stash.
meanings.sent4: The moon confides in the night, revealing its hidden beauty.
meanings.sent5: The captain confides in his first mate, entrusting him with the map to treasure.
